title: Good app with two staggering flaws
text:
1. Every 2-3 months, the app goes back to displaying a notification “open outlook to view message” when I receive a new email. This is completely unacceptable when the only solution is to delete and redownload the app. 

2. No ability to schedule send emails from app. Have to use online version. How is something so simple missing from outlook.

title: Irritating!
text: Please fix the reply reply all options. I should not have to scroll all the to the end of the email or chain to reply. I would suggest a floating reply button.

title: A surprisingly good email client.
text:
Search is better than it was, and has strong integration with organization-wide Office and email. 

Nifty adoption of select mark down attributes for fast composing, and pretty good integration of voice for going through and responding to email when you don’t feel like using the keyboard.

title: Update 4/5/24
text: Hello I updated my app today & now my email won’t load. I actually noticed it seems to be a reoccurring issue since I hadn’t received email since Friday & when I logged in on the website I had several missed messages.

title: Mostly Good
text: Outlook on my iPhone is pretty useful except that i periodically cannot find emails I know are there. Also, the junk and blocking functions appear to be completely useless. I even get emails with the offer to unblock the blocked sender. This is EXTREMELY frustrating and will be the reason I dump this app at some point. It wastes my time and I really don’t have the patience.

title: Save Contacts is broken yet again
text: If I enable this it duplicates all contacts in my iPhone. Microsoft, how hard is it to figure this out with Apple?

title: Message Previews not working since new update
text: Latest update made it so I don’t longer get a preview on my Notification Center

title: Push notifications don’t have any details
text: Since the last update, push notifications for emails do not have any details about who the sender is or what the subject of the email is. It only states “email notification “. Please fix this. I need to be able to see these push notifications properly for work purposes.

title: Can’t delete accounts
text: Not being able to remove accounts is an insane feature. Way to go, Microsoft.

title: Search function is too random
text:
Very weak app - some really basic and important interfaces don’t work well. 

For starters, it’s very hard to search things in my emails. The app takes way too much liberty interpreting terms that are similar to my search terms. Doesn’t allow me to add “” or ‘’ either to narrow down search to more precise terms or look for combinations of words. Also doesn’t show me which email the term is found in, instead it randomly shows other emails from the thread that don’t even contain those words… 
The other thing that is really missing but should be such a basic function, is to be able to check the calendar while you compose an email. Now you need to exit the email you’re writing, open the calendar and then exit the calendar  and go all the way back and find the draft email in the drafts folder. That’s unnecessarily convoluted, isn’t it?

title: Change to notifications?
text: All of a sudden the notifications aren’t showing anything specific about the email. Only showing “new email - tap to read!” Why do you guys change things that aren’t broken!

title: Great for the most part
text: With some exceptions (I’m looking at you Word), when it comes to their office products on Apple platforms, Microsoft tends to execute a few steps short of perfectly. But those short steps can be chew-through-your-workdesk-annoying. The iOS Outlook app has a solid user interface. It’s quite stable and doesn’t have a lot of bugs. When it comes to reading and composing emails, it does what it’s supposed to do. But a few (what some would see as minor) things are incredibly annoying. Why in the world can’t I customize my font when composing emails? This seems like an easy feature to provide. Why is it 2024 and we can’t get our email signatures to look the way we want them to look? And don’t get me started with trying to include images in them. Again, a few steps short of perfect. Works well, but wish they would give some more attention to those steps.

text: It continues to improve but remains cumbersome

title: Outlook Review
text: Outlook is a great tool for sending emails professionally and it is connected to many other Microsoft apps which I like. The only reason I have it one star is because it doesn’t show notifications so I must constantly look in the app to see if someone has emailed me. Otherwise, I definitely recommend Outlook!

title: Not respecting quiet mode
text: Outlook is not following my quiet mode time anymore. It’s sending me push notifications for emails even when quiet mode is enabled.

title: Contacts
text: Outlook mobile is awesome except for the contacts. Wish we could view them better.

title: Update adds advertisements that look like emails
text:
Previously, this was my go-to email app for iPhone for 6+ years. It has a lot of functionality wrapped into one app and was free. With a new update, they have added advertisements to the email pane that look identical to regular emails, purposely made to mislead individuals into clicking them. I can half understand the need to monetize a free product but this is an unacceptable implementation and I'll be moving on from this point.

Hope to see an update in the future to remove this and maybe Microsoft can look for a better way to monetize their product instead of intending to mislead their user base.

title: Signature is a mess
text: I’d it crazy to think you can use the same email signature across different platforms. Well you can’t. It’s a big miss in 2024
Learning outlook is giving me better clarity of office benefits

title: Desperately need a way to totally block senders
text:
I am swamped on IOS Outlook app with spam and unwanted senders. Outlook does not have any way to totally block senders. All users desperately need to be able to do this. 

Come on developers, help us out.

title: No ToDo lists in app
text:
This could be a fantastic mobile version of the desktop app. Unfortunately, they left out one HUGE feature from Outlook… the To Do list. 

For some insane reason, they make you download a separate app just for tasks. Even though tasks do appear in the desktop app. 

Tasks have due dates, which means they should be in the same app as the calendar, so we can manage our agenda each day without having to flip back-and-forth between two apps.

It works this way in the desktop version of Outlook, so why do they force us to be less productive on mobile? Crazy.

title: Good functioning except searching
text: The search function doesn’t put emails in date order and sometimes misses things. Several of us at work have had trouble with the search

title: Please adopt iPadOS system and other features to make it productive
text: Outlook should 1) adopt iPadOS’s multi-window features; 2) formatting an email should have more features; 3) saving in an email attachment into OneDrive should a matter of just dragging and dropping (I get an error message); and 4) it should allow users to save attachments in other SharePoint sites than only the personal OneDrive account.

title: Great app for mobile, needs Vision Pro Native
text:
First and foremost, thank you for making such a great mobile experience. This is my go to app for email. It supports all of my various personal and work accounts seamlessly.

For Vision Pro, please release a native application. Currently, Outlook will not allow me to open M365 attachments in the Naive Vision Pro applications. This would be a fantastic capability.

Related, but not to Outlook, please provide access to OneDrive in either a compatibility app, or on native Vision Pro. The lack of this feature is making workflows challenging on the Vision Pro.
